attributes.comment:
The fee increase for adoption related fees is unconscionable. The federal
government has demonstrated a preference for adoptions, i.e., by supporting a
tax credit. This fee erodes that support by requiring that part of the credited
fees be paid right back to the federal government in the form of processing
fees. USCIS needs to increase its funding, since the waits for processing of
fingerprints and home studies in some parts of the country are abominable.
However, it should not increase its funding on the backs of the adoptive parents
who are already being prohibitively charged for adoption related costs, and who
are helping our country and other nations reduce governmental costs spent on
orphans. USCIS should find another way to locate financial support.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sherry M. Phillips
